notes.text:
Updated java-1.6.0-sun packages that correct several security issues are
now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 4 Extras and 5 Supplementary.

This update has been rated as having critical security impact by the Red
Hat Security Response Team.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
The Java Runtime Environment (JRE) contains the software and tools that
users need to run applets and applications written using the Java
programming language. 

A vulnerability was found in in Java Web Start. If a user visits a
malicious website, an attacker could misuse this flaw to execute arbitrary
code. (CVE-2008-2086)

Additionally, these packages fix several other critical vulnerabilities.
These are summarized in the "Advance notification of Security Updates for
Java SE" from Sun Microsystems.

Users of java-1.6.0-sun should upgrade to these updated packages, which
correct these issues.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: Sun Java Web Start and Java Plug-in for JDK and JRE 6 Update 10 and earlier; JDK and JRE 5.0 Update 16 and earlier; and SDK and JRE 1.4.2_18 and earlier allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted jnlp file that modifies the (1) java.home, (2) java.ext.dirs, or (3) user.home System Properties, aka "Java Web Start File Inclusion" and CR 6694892.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Java Web Start File Inclusion via System Properties Override
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released
errata relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via Red Hat Network.  Details on how to use
the Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
http://kbase.redhat.com/faq/FAQ_58_10188

vulnerabilities.title: Java Web Start File Inclusion via System Properties Override

notes.text: Unspecified vulnerability in Java Web Start (JWS) and Java Plug-in with Sun JDK and JRE 6 Update 10 and earlier; JDK and JRE 5.0 Update 16 and earlier; and SDK and JRE 1.4.2_18 and earlier allows untrusted JWS applications to perform network connections to unauthorized hosts via unknown vectors, aka CR 6727079.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: JavaWebStart allows unauthorized network connections
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released
errata relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via Red Hat Network.  Details on how to use
the Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
http://kbase.redhat.com/faq/FAQ_58_10188

vulnerabilities.title: JavaWebStart allows unauthorized network connections

notes.text: Unspecified vulnerability in Java Web Start (JWS) and Java Plug-in with Sun JDK and JRE 6 Update 10 and earlier; JDK and JRE 5.0 Update 16 and earlier; and SDK and JRE 1.4.2_18 and earlier allows untrusted JWS applications to gain privileges to access local files or applications via unknown vectors, aka 6727081.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Java WebStart privilege escalation
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

vulnerabilities.title: Java WebStart privilege escalation

notes.text: Unspecified vulnerability in Java Web Start (JWS) and Java Plug-in with Sun JDK and JRE 6 Update 10 and earlier, and JDK and JRE 5.0 Update 16 and earlier, allows untrusted JWS applications to obtain the pathname of the JWS cache and the application username via unknown vectors, aka CR 6727071.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Java Web Start exposes username and the pathname of the JWS cache
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released
errata relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via Red Hat Network.  Details on how to use
the Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
http://kbase.redhat.com/faq/FAQ_58_10188

vulnerabilities.title: Java Web Start exposes username and the pathname of the JWS cache

notes.text: Unspecified vulnerability in the BasicService for Java Web Start (JWS) and Java Plug-in with Sun JDK and JRE 6 Update 10 and earlier; JDK and JRE 5.0 Update 16 and earlier; and SDK and JRE 1.4.2_18 and earlier allows untrusted downloaded applications to cause local files to be displayed in the browser of the user of the untrusted application via unknown vectors, aka 6767668.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Java Web Start BasicService displays local files in the browser
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released
errata relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via Red Hat Network.  Details on how to use
the Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at

vulnerabilities.title: Java Web Start BasicService displays local files in the browser

notes.text: Java Web Start (JWS) and Java Plug-in with Sun JDK and JRE 6 Update 10 and earlier; JDK and JRE 5.0 Update 16 and earlier; and SDK and JRE 1.4.2_18 and earlier allows remote attackers to make unauthorized network connections and hijack HTTP sessions via a crafted file that validates as both a GIF and a Java JAR file, aka "GIFAR" and CR 6707535.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Java WebStart allows hidden code privilege escalation
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released

This update is available via Red Hat Network.  Details on how to use
the Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
http://kbase.redhat.com/faq/FAQ_58_10188

vulnerabilities.title: Java WebStart allows hidden code privilege escalation

notes.text: Unspecified vulnerability in Java Web Start (JWS) and Java Plug-in with Sun JDK and JRE 6 Update 10 and earlier; JDK and JRE 5.0 Update 16 and earlier; and SDK and JRE 1.4.2_18 and earlier allows untrusted applets to read arbitrary files and make unauthorized network connections via unknown vectors related to applet classloading, aka 6716217.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Java WebStart unprivileged local file and network access
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released

notes.text: Unspecified vulnerability in Java Runtime Environment (JRE) with Sun JDK and JRE 6 Update 10 and earlier; JDK and JRE 5.0 Update 16 and earlier; SDK and JRE 1.4.2_18 and earlier; and SDK and JRE 1.3.1_23 and earlier allows code that is loaded from a local filesystem to read arbitrary files and make unauthorized connections to localhost via unknown vectors.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: JRE allows unauthorized file access and connections to localhost
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Java Runtime Environment (JRE) for Sun JDK and JRE 6 Update 10 and earlier allow untrusted applets and applications to gain privileges via vectors related to access to inner classes in the (1) JAX-WS and (2) JAXB packages.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: OpenJDK applet privilege escalation via JAX package access (6592792)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

vulnerabilities.title: OpenJDK applet privilege escalation via JAX package access (6592792)

notes.text: Unspecified vulnerability in Java Runtime Environment (JRE) for Sun JDK and JRE 6 Update 10 and earlier; JDK and JRE 5.0 Update 16 and earlier; and SDK and JRE 1.4.2_18 and earlier, when using Kerberos authentication, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (OS resource consumption) via unknown vectors.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: OpenJDK Denial-Of-Service in kerberos authentication (6588160)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released

notes.text: Unspecified vulnerability in Java Runtime Environment (JRE) for Sun JDK and JRE 6 Update 10 and earlier, and JDK and JRE 5.0 Update 16 and earlier, allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (CPU consumption) via a crafted RSA public key.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: OpenJDK RSA public key length denial-of-service (6497740)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

notes.text: Unspecified vulnerability in Java Runtime Environment (JRE) for Sun JDK and JRE 6 Update 10 and earlier; JDK and JRE 5.0 Update 16 and earlier; and SDK and JRE 1.4.2_18 and earlier allows untrusted applications and applets to list the contents of the operating user's directory via unknown vectors.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: OpenJDK allows to list files within the user home directory (6484091)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released
errata relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via Red Hat Network.  Details on how to use

vulnerabilities.title: OpenJDK allows to list files within the user home directory (6484091)

notes.text: Java Runtime Environment (JRE) for Sun JDK and JRE 6 Update 10 and earlier; JDK and JRE 5.0 Update 16 and earlier; and SDK and JRE 1.4.2_18 and earlier accepts UTF-8 encodings that are not the "shortest" form, which makes it easier for attackers to bypass protection mechanisms for other applications that rely on shortest-form UTF-8 encodings.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: OpenJDK UTF-8 decoder accepts non-shortest form sequences (4486841)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released
errata relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via Red Hat Network.  Details on how to use
the Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
http://kbase.redhat.com/faq/FAQ_58_10188

vulnerabilities.title: OpenJDK UTF-8 decoder accepts non-shortest form sequences (4486841)

notes.text: Integer overflow in the JAR unpacking utility (unpack200) in the unpack library (unpack.dll) in Java Runtime Environment (JRE) for Sun JDK and JRE 6 Update 10 and earlier, and JDK and JRE 5.0 Update 16 and earlier, allows untrusted applications and applets to gain privileges via a Pack200 compressed JAR file that triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: OpenJDK Jar200 Decompression buffer overflow (6755943)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released
errata relevant to your system have been applied.

This update is available via Red Hat Network.  Details on how to use
the Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
http://kbase.redhat.com/faq/FAQ_58_10188

vulnerabilities.title: OpenJDK Jar200 Decompression buffer overflow (6755943)

notes.text: The Java Runtime Environment (JRE) for Sun JDK and JRE 6 Update 10 and earlier; JDK and JRE 5.0 Update 16 and earlier; and SDK and JRE 1.4.2_18 and earlier does not properly enforce context of ZoneInfo objects during deserialization, which allows remote attackers to run untrusted applets and applications in a privileged context, as demonstrated by "deserializing Calendar objects".
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: OpenJDK calendar object deserialization allows privilege escalation (6734167)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

remediations.details:
Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released

This update is available via Red Hat Network.  Details on how to use
the Red Hat Network to apply this update are available at
http://kbase.redhat.com/faq/FAQ_58_10188

vulnerabilities.title: OpenJDK calendar object deserialization allows privilege escalation (6734167)

notes.text: Stack-based buffer overflow in Java Runtime Environment (JRE) for Sun JDK and JRE 6 Update 10 and earlier; JDK and JRE 5.0 Update 16 and earlier; and SDK and JRE 1.4.2_18 and earlier allows locally-launched and possibly remote untrusted Java applications to execute arbitrary code via a JAR file with a long Main-Class manifest entry.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: OpenJDK Privilege escalation in command line applications (6733959)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

vulnerabilities.title: OpenJDK Privilege escalation in command line applications (6733959)

notes.text: Heap-based buffer overflow in Java Runtime Environment (JRE) for Sun JDK and JRE 6 Update 10 and earlier; JDK and JRE 5.0 Update 16 and earlier; and SDK and JRE 1.4.2_18 and earlier might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted TrueType font file.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: OpenJDK Font processing vulnerability (6733336)

notes.text: Integer overflow in Java Runtime Environment (JRE) for Sun JDK and JRE 6 Update 10 and earlier; JDK and JRE 5.0 Update 16 and earlier; SDK and JRE 1.4.2_18 and earlier; and SDK and JRE 1.3.1_23 and earlier might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted TrueType font file, which triggers a heap-based buffer overflow.

notes.text: OpenJDK Truetype Font processing vulnerability (6751322)

vulnerabilities.title: OpenJDK Truetype Font processing vulnerability (6751322)

notes.text: Java Runtime Environment (JRE) for Sun JDK and JRE 6 Update 10 and earlier might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code via a crafted GIF file that triggers memory corruption during display of the splash screen, possibly related to splashscreen.dll.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: OpenJDK Buffer Overflow in GIF image processing (6766136)
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

Before applying this update, make sure that all previously-released

This update is available via Red Hat Network.  Details on how to use

vulnerabilities.title: OpenJDK Buffer Overflow in GIF image processing (6766136)

notes.text: Buffer overflow in Java Runtime Environment (JRE) for Sun JDK and JRE 6 Update 10 and earlier; JDK and JRE 5.0 Update 16 and earlier; SDK and JRE 1.4.2_18 and earlier; and SDK and JRE 1.3.1_23 and earlier might allow remote attackers to execute arbitrary code, related to a ConvolveOp operation in the Java AWT library.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: OpenJDK Buffer overflow in image processing (6726779)

vulnerabilities.title: OpenJDK Buffer overflow in image processing (6726779)

notes.text: Java Runtime Environment (JRE) for Sun JDK and JRE 6 Update 10 and earlier; JDK and JRE 5.0 Update 16 and earlier; SDK and JRE 1.4.2_18 and earlier; and SDK and JRE 1.3.1_23 and earlier creates temporary files with predictable file names, which allows attackers to write malicious JAR files via unknown vectors.
notes.title: Vulnerability description
